definition[0]: the official punishment of death, ordered by a judge
example[1]: Premeditated murder carries  (=is punished by) the death sentence.
definition[1]: something such as an illness that makes you sure you will die
example[2]: Cancer is no longer a death sentence.
definition[2]: an action or decision that is very harmful to someone or something
example[3]: In 1987, the government passed a death sentence on the river by granting permission for the new dam.
